column4: i can't access my windows share via linux or my linux share via windows
so you just installed smb and it just worked?
the add network folder being in nautilus?
it's fine im gonna throw this fuckin piece of shit out the window
is your problem involving samba? I may actually be able to help you, but I came in too late to see your question
i'm not so hot at windows 7... but do you think your problem is configuration maybe?
are you logging in with an admin user? Should try that first make sure there aren't weird permissions things going on.  Check the permissions on the files you are sharing on samba
let me get this straight, your end goal is to just get files off your windows 7 machine and ONTO an ubuntu mahine?
winscp will resume if something happens for any reason
1. go to ubuntu machine and do sudo apt-get install ssh 2. go to windows machine and download and install winscp
type this exactly in a prompt without the quotes "sudo apt-get install ssh"
yes, something along the lines of 192.168.1.*** usually
yes, put that ip in your hostname and same username/password you use to login to the computer
the server should already be going after you installed it
thanks, let's hope the karma passes along
